comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: From the tall buildings behind, this must be the July 1928 visit. Moored at P&O wharf, Bennelong Point, where the Opera House is now. Read All About It - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16478526 Captain Geronimo Costa Palma - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16479223

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: The SLNSW have an image supposedly showing the PRESIDENTE SARMIENTO with the Harbour Bridge in the background, ie later than 1932 - strange !? - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au//item/itemDetailPaged.aspx?itemID=220390

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Think you're right, we had a hunch that might be the case. That is strange, SLNSW must have the vessel wrong as PRESIDENTE SARMIENTO did not visit Sydney after 1928.
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 9566397@N07
comment._content: Sarmiento Trip 1902 Zarpó el 20 de Febrero de 1901 y regresó el 13 de Febrero de 1902. Bahía Blanca - San Antonio - San José - Madryn - Cabo Raso - Tillí - Santa Cruz -Gallegos - Punta Arenas - Cabo Pilar (salida al Pacífico) - Papeeté (Tahití) - Apia (Samoa) - Suva (Fidji) - Auckland - Wellington - Melbourne - Sidney - Brisbane -Thursday-Island - Timor - Macassar - Singapore - Pointe de Galle - Bombay - Aden -Massaua - Suez - Ismailía - Port Said - Alejandría - De este último se dirigió a Gibraltar para trasbordar los Aspirantes al vapor italiano "SIRIO" y dirigirse luego a Spezia para embarcar material de guerra. El personal destacado llegó a Buenos Aires el 8 de Enero y la Fragata el 13 de Febrero de 1902. Navegó 33.803 millas.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/9566397@N07] Thank you for those details hector M.ARG. We hope you enjoyed our photostream.
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
